relation: configure terminal Example: Device# configure terminal
interface atm interface-number[.subinterface-number {mpls | multipoint | point-to-point}] Example: Device(config)# interface atm 6/0.20 point-to-point
vbr-nrt output-pcr output-scr output-maxburstsize Example: Device(config-if-atm-vc)# vbr-nrt 512 256 20
pppoe-client dial-pool-number number Example: Device(config-if-atm-vc)# pppoe-client dial-pool-number 6
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Specifies the ATM interface for which Multilink PPP must be configured and enters interface configuration mode.
Specifies the encapsulation type on an ATM permanent virtual circuit (PVC) and enters ATM virtual circuit configuration mode.
Configures the variable bit rate-nonreal time (VBR-NRT) and specifies output peak cell rate (PCR), output sustainable cell rate (SCR), and output maximum burst cell size for an ATM PVC.
Exits ATM virtual circuit configuration mode and returns to privileged EXEC mode.
pageTitle: Wide-Area Networking Configuration Guide: Multilink PPP, Cisco IOS XE Release 3S (Cisco ASR 1000) - Configuring Multilink PPP Connections for Broadband and Serial Topologies [Cisco ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {291517=RFC 1990, 290316=Multilink PPP Feature Functionality on the ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Router, 291804=RFC 2686, 5254=The Multilink PPP feature provides load balancing functionality over multiple WAN links while providing multivendor interoperability and support for packet fragmentation, proper sequencing, and load calculation on both inbound and outbound traffic. The Multilink PPP feature supports the fragmentation and packet sequencing specifications described in RFC 1990., 33457=For a more detailed explanation, refer to the “Broadband Scalability and Performance” module in the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Routers Software Configuration Guide.}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 8.    show ppp multilink 7.    end 6.    ppp multilink group group-number 5.    ppp multilink 4.    ip address address mask 3.    interface multilink group-number 2.    configure terminal 1.    enable SUMMARY STEPS Creating a Multilink Bundle Changing the Default Endpoint Discriminator Configuring Minimum Multilink PPP Links Assigning an Interface to a Multilink Bundle Creating a Multilink Bundle Before configuring Multilink PPP connections between CPE and PTA devices, you must configure Multilink PPP by performing the following tasks: Configuring Multilink PPP Configuring Multilink PPP over Serial Interfaces Configuring Multilink PPP over Broadband Configuring Multilink PPP Interleaving and Queueing Configuring Multilink PPP How to Configure Multilink PPP Connections for Broadband and Serial
textAfterTable: Step 8 show ppp multilink Example: Device# show ppp multilink   Displays Multilink PPP bundle information.   Assigning an Interface to a Multilink Bundle Caution Do not install a route to the peer address while configuring a Multilink PPP lease line. The route can be disabled using the no ppp peer-neighbor-route command on the Multilink PPP bundle interface. SUMMARY STEPS 1.    enable 2.    configure terminal 3.    interface serial slot/subslot/port 4.    no ip address 5.    encapsulation ppp 6.    keepalive seconds 7.    ppp multilink 8.    ppp multilink group
